sen.j: 松木松年（まつき しょうねん、男性、天保14年（1843年） - 大正6年（1917年）12月28日）は、幕末から近代日本の画家・篆刻家である。
sen.e: Shonen MATSUKI (male 1843-28 December, 1917) is a tenkoku artist and a painter from the end of Edo period to modern times of Japan.
Shonen MATSUKI (male, 1843-December 28, 1917) is a tenkoku artist and a painter from the end of Edo period to modern Japan.
sen.cmt: 日付の表記を変更しました。
sen.e: Shonen MATSUKI (male, 1843 - December 28, 1917) is a tenkoku artist and a painter from the end of Edo period to modern Japan.
sen.cmt: ハイフンの前後にスペースを入れました。

sen.j: 名は偉彦（くすひこ）、字は子温、松年は最初の号 (称号)で後に香雲・五峰などと称した。
sen.e: His name was Kusuhiko and his Azana is Shion, and Shonen is his first Go (a second name or alias), then he called himself Koun or Goho.
sen.cmt: 子温→Shion (子温) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］香雲→Koun (香雲) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］五峰→Goho (五峰) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His name was Kusuhiko and his Azana is Shion, and Shonen is his first Go (a second name or alias), then he called himself Koun or Goho.
His name was Kusuhiko and his Azana is Shion, and Shonen is his first Go (a second name or alias), then he called himself Koun or Goho.
He was born in Isewatarai County.
He was born in Isewatarai County.
He was born in Isewatarai County.
Brief Biography
Brief Biography
Brief Biography

sen.j: 松木武彦の子で、松木品彦の養子。
sen.e: He was a child of Takehiko MATSUKI and an adopted child of Shinahiko MATSUKI.
sen.cmt: 松木武彦→Takehiko MATSUKI (松木武彦) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］松木品彦→Shinahiko MATSUKI (松木品彦) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He was a child of Takehiko MATSUKI and an adopted child of Shinahiko MATSUKI.
He was a child of Takehiko MATSUKI and an adopted child of Shinahiko MATSUKI.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮禰宜を務めた。
sen.e: He served as Negi (Shinto priest) in Ise Jingu Shirine.
He served as Negi (Shinto priest) in Ise Jingu Shirine.
He served as Negi (Shinto priest) in Ise Jingu Shirine.

sen.j: 幕末に官位官位相当表に至るが、明治維新後一旦返上し改めて従七位に叙される。
sen.e: He was ranked in the official court ranking in the end of Edo period but he returned the award after Meiji Restoration, then he was promoted to Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).
sen.cmt: 原文「官位官位相当表に至る」の意味が不明
sen.e: He was ranked in the official court ranking in the end of Edo period but he returned the award after the Meiji Restoration, which he was then promoted to Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).
He was ranked in the official court ranking in the end of Edo period but he returned the award after the Meiji Restoration, which he was then promoted to Jushichii (Junior Seventh Rank).

sen.j: 画は谷口藹山・松田雪柯に学び、篆刻は福井端隠の門下。
sen.e: He learned paintings from Aizan TANIGUCHI and Sekka MATSUDA, and learned Tenkoku (seal-engraving) from Tanin FUKUI as his disciple.
sen.cmt: 松田雪柯→Sekka MATSUDA (松田雪柯) ［Kotobank.jp http://kotobank.jp/］
sen.e: He learned paintings from Aizan TANIGUCHI and Sekka MATSUDA, and learned Tenkoku (seal-engraving) from Tanin FUKUI as his disciple.
He learned paintings from Aizan TANIGUCHI and Sekka MATSUDA, and learned Tenkoku (seal-engraving) from Tanin FUKUI as his disciple.

sen.j: 自刻の印譜に『五峰印譜』がある。
sen.e: He produced his own Inpu (compilation of seal marks) "Goho Inpu".
sen.cmt: 五峰印譜→Goho Inpu (五峰印譜) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He produced his own Inpu (compilation of seal marks) "Goho Inpu".
He produced his own Inpu (compilation of seal marks) "Goho Inpu".

sen.j: また馬術は大坪流の林又蔵に師事した。
sen.e: He also studied Japanese horse-back archery technique under Matazo HAYASHI of Otsubo school.
sen.cmt: 林又蔵→Matazo HAYASHI (林又蔵) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He also studied Japanese horse-back archery technique under Matazo HAYASHI of Otsubo school.
He also studied Japanese horse-back archery technique under Matazo HAYASHI of Otsubo school.
He died at 75.
He died at 75.
He died at 75.
